alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 30 at 9:45AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A line of strong showers and isolated thunderstorms will impact portions of New Hanover, Pender and eastern Brunswick Counties through 1045 AM EST... At 945 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers and isolated thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ivanhoe to near Little River. Movement was toward the east at 40 to 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Burgaw, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Surf City, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, Figure Eight Island, Yaupon Beach, Masonboro Island, Hampstead, Boiling Spring Lakes and St. James. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building until these storm pass through the area.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
